Detailed Description

The Caller ID Interface.

FXS-Caller ID

The Caller-ID will display in the callee's phone during the ringing signal. It can be classified into two categories.
One is DTMF mode and the other is FSK mode.
For DTMF mode, there are three kinds of DTMF.

  • Inband
  • SIP INFO
  • RFC2833
For FSK mode, there are four kinds of FSK.

  • Bellcore FSK
  • ETSI FSK
  • BT FSK
  • NTT FSK

Function Documentation

int32 rtk_StopCid ( uint32  chid,
char  cid_mode 
)

Stop Caller ID Generation.

Parameters
chidThe FXS channel number.
cid_modeCaller ID mode.
0: DTMF Caller ID
1: FSK Caller ID
2: Both DTMF and FSK Caller ID
Note
If stop CID generation, we can't receive end event.
Return values
0Success
Examples:
caller_id.c.
int32 rtk_GenCidAndFxsRing ( uint32  chid,
char  cid_mode,
char *  str_cid,
char *  str_date,
char *  str_cid_name,
char  fsk_type,
uint32  bRinging 
)

Caller ID generation and FXS Ring.

Parameters
chidThe FXS channel number.
cid_modeThe mode of Caller ID
0:DTMF
1:FSK
str_cidThe Caller ID
str_dateThe Caller Date
str_cid_nameThe Caller ID Name
fsk_typeFSK type
0: type I
1: type II
bRinging0: Disable Ringing
1: Enable Ringing
Note
When str_cid is NULL(no CID number), this API won't send CID, and then just perform disable/enable FXS Ring.
When application calls this API to send FSK caller ID, DSPring the phone automatically after sending caller ID even bRinging is equal to zero.
So, there is no need to ring the phone by application.
If caller ID is configured to send between 1st and 2nd ring, DSP also can handle it with ring cadence automatically.
If str_cid[0] is equal to zero, caller ID won't be send. In this situation, this API will ring on/off the phone according to the parameter bRinging.
Return values
0Success
Examples:
fskgen.c, and fxo.c.
int32 rtk_SetCidDetMode ( uint32  chid,
int  auto_det,
int  cid_det_mode 
)

Set the FXO Caller ID Detection Mode.

Parameters
chidThe FXO channel number
auto_detThe FXO CID auto detection mode
0: Disable Caller ID Auto Detection
1: Enable Caller ID Auto Detection (NTT Support).
2: Enable Caller ID Auto Detection (NTT Not Support)
Default: 2
cid_det_modeThe Caller ID Mode for Caller ID Detection (available only when the auto_det=0)
Available range: 0 ~ 4
0: Bellcore FSK
1: ETSI FSK
2: BT FSK
3: NTT FSK
4: DTMF
Default: 4
Return values
0Success
Note
Virtual DAA not support
Examples:
fxo.c.
